description: The ``opc_compute_ip_reservation`` resource creates and manages an IP reservation in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain for the Shared Network.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Name.description: Name of the IP Reservation. Will be generated if unspecified.

ParentPool.description: The pool from which to allocate the IP address. Defaults to `/oracle/public/ippool`, and is currently the only acceptable input.

Permanent.description:
Whether the IP address remains reserved even when it is no longer associated with an instance
(if true), or may be returned to the pool and replaced with a different IP address when an instance is restarted, or
deleted and recreated (if false).

Tags.description: List of tags that may be applied to the IP reservation.
